marketNews.title: Economist Faisal Says Household Consumption Growth Slower Than GDP in 2Q24
marketNews.content: Director of the Center of Reform on Economics Indonesia, Mohammad Faisal, told Kompas that household consumption growth (+4.93% YoY) was lower than Indonesia's overall economic growth (+5.05% YoY) in 2Q24, due to a decline in purchasing power of the middle class. He warned that the government should be cautious about policies that could further pressure the middle class, such as the proposed increase of VAT to 12% and the expansion of excise objects. Meanwhile, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto assessed that the 2Q24 household consumption result was fairly high.

marketNews.title: AISI Revises 2024 Domestic Motorcycle Sales Target to 6.2‑6.3 Million Units
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Commercial Division of the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI), Sigit Kumala, said the association revised its 2024 domestic motorcycle sales target from a range of 6.2‑6.5 million units to 6.2‑6.3 million units. The revision was caused by weak domestic motorcycle sales in 1H24, which fell 0.97% YoY to 3.17 million units. Kumala explained that the decline was pressured by weaker purchasing power of consumers amid a spike in food inflation and a still‑high policy interest rate.

marketNews.title: Business Leaders Urge Reinstatement of Employee Income Tax Incentive
marketNews.content: Business leaders and economic observers suggested that the government reinstate employee income tax (PPh) incentives to preserve the purchasing power of the middle class, which has been weakening recently. The measure had previously been provided by the government from April 2020 to December 2021 for employees with a gross annual income below 200 million rupiah.

marketNews.title: President‑Elect Prabowo to Announce Cabinet on 21 October 2024
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said that President‑elect Prabowo Subianto plans to announce his cabinet lineup on 21 October 2024, a day after his inauguration.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserves Reach US$145.4 Billion in July 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves rose to US$145.4 billion at the end of July 2024, up from US$140.2 billion in June 2024. The increase was driven by the issuance of a global sovereign sukuk and higher tax and service revenues. The reserve level is equivalent to 6.5 months of import financing or 6.3 months of import financing plus external debt service.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Reinstates Safeguard Import Duty on Fabrics and Carpets
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance, led by Sri Mulyani, reinstated a safeguard import duty (BMTP) on imported fabrics, carpets and floor‑covering textiles, effective 9 August 2024 for a three‑year period. The measure, which had lapsed in 2022, was re‑introduced after complaints from the domestic textile industry about competition from cheap imports.

marketNews.title: Cerestar Indonesia Targets 3Q24 Commissioning of New Gresik Plant
marketNews.content: Cerestar Indonesia's President Director Indra Irawan said the company aims to commission a new plant in Gresik in 3Q24. The new machine will raise the plant’s capacity from 600 tons per day to 2,200 tons per day.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Re‑imposes Safeguard Import Duty on Textiles
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance, Sri Mulyani, re‑imposed a safeguard import duty (BMTP) on imported fabrics, carpets and floor‑covering textiles, effective 9 August 2024 for three years. The duty, which had previously expired in 2022, was re‑introduced following complaints from the domestic textile sector about competition from cheap imports.

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata (EXCL) 1H24 Net Profit +58% YoY, Beats Estimates
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata (EXCL) reported net profit of IDR 486 billion (+8% YoY, –10% QoQ) in 2Q24, bringing 1H24 net profit to IDR 1 trillion (+58% YoY), surpassing the FY24 consensus estimate at 57% of the forecast. Operating profit grew 12% YoY and 0.3% QoQ, lifting 1H24 operating profit by 34% YoY, also above the consensus at 53% of the FY24 estimate. Mobile subscriber base grew to 58.5 million (+1% YoY, +2% QoQ) in 2Q24; average revenue per mobile subscriber (ARPU) held at IDR 44,000 (+5% YoY, 0% QoQ) despite lower marketing and G&A expenses, which improved profit margins. Management said the subscriber and ARPU growth stemmed from network‑quality investments in low‑share‑of‑market cities, and expects marketing spend to rise in 2H24 due to seasonality and competition. The company also aims to become a market leader in ARPU through a payment‑app integration strategy. No upgrade to FY24 guidance was given; the company kept its FY24 outlook of high single‑digit revenue growth, ~50% EBITDA margin and IDR 8 trillion capex, citing ongoing competition uncertainty. The FY24 financials do not yet reflect the integration of Link Net (LINK) revenue and profit, as the timeline remains uncertain.

tickerNews.title: ADRO 1H24 Thermal Coal Sales +5% YoY
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) recorded a coal production volume of 17.66 million tonnes (‑2% QoQ, 0% YoY) in 2Q24, bringing 1H24 production to 35.74 million tonnes (+7% YoY). Thermal coal sales reached 16.92 million tonnes (+10% QoQ, +6% YoY) in 2Q24, resulting in 1H24 thermal coal sales of 32.35 million tonnes (+5% YoY). Metallurgical coal sales through subsidiary Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR) were 1.54 million tonnes (+47% QoQ, +59% YoY) in 2Q24, giving 1H24 metallurgical sales of 2.59 million tonnes (+43% YoY). The stripping ratio was 4.27× in 2Q24 (vs. 3.66× in 1Q24, 4.14× in 2Q23), and 3.96× for 1H24 (vs. 3.88× in 1H23).

tickerNews.title: MDKA 2Q24 Gold and Copper Sales
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) reported 2Q24 gold sales of 25,000 ounces (‑6% QoQ, ‑15% YoY) for $56.6 million (‑1% QoQ, ‑2% YoY), bringing 1H24 gold sales to 51.6 k ounces (+4% YoY) and $112.7 million (+17% YoY). Copper sales were 2 k tonnes (‑53% QoQ, ‑53% YoY) for $18.7 million (‑48% QoQ, ‑49% YoY), resulting in 1H24 copper sales of 6.3 k tonnes (‑20% YoY) and $54.7 million (‑21% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MBMA 2Q24 NPI, Nickel Matte and Limonite Sales
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) posted 2Q24 NPI sales of 20.8 k tonnes (‑4% QoQ, +89% YoY) for $240.5 million (+1% QoQ, +54% YoY), lifting 1H24 NPI sales to ~42.5 k tonnes (+121% YoY) and $479.5 million (+60% YoY). Nickel matte sales were 12.8 k tonnes (‑11% QoQ, +322% YoY) for $189.8 million (‑4% QoQ, +258% YoY), giving 1H24 nickel matte sales of 27.2 k tonnes (+796% YoY) and $386.7 million (+630% YoY). Limonite ore sales were ~2.9 k wmt (+360% QoQ) in 2Q24 for $47.2 million (+477% QoQ), resulting in 1H24 limonite sales of ~3.5 k wmt and $55.5 million.

tickerNews.title: PSSI Announces IDR 146.7 B Interim Dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: IMC Pelita Logistik (PSSI) will distribute an interim dividend for FY2024 of IDR 146.7 billion, or IDR 28 per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiation on 8 August 2024, with payment on 30 August 2024. Using the closing price of IDR 458 per share on 7 August 2024, the implied dividend yield is 6.1%.

tickerNews.title: RAAM Announces 10% Private Placement of 619.4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Tripar Multivision Plus (RAAM) plans a private placement of up to 619.4 million shares (10% of the company) that would cause a 9.09% dilution. The issue price and investors have not been disclosed; proceeds will be used for business development investments. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 12 September 2024.

tickerNews.title: MARK Announces IDR 76 B Interim Dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: Mark Dynamics Indonesia (MARK) will distribute an interim dividend for FY2024 of IDR 76 billion, or IDR 20 per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiation on 15 August 2024, with payment on 6 September 2024. Using the closing price of IDR 935 per share on 7 August 2024, the implied dividend yield is 2.1%.

tickerNews.title: MTEL Raises Fiber‑Optic Expansion Target to 14,000 km, Lowers Tenant Target
tickerNews.content: MTEL’s Investment Director Hendra Purnama said the company has revised its 2024 fiber‑optic expansion target from 10,000 km to 14,000 km, while the 2024 tenant‑addition target was cut from 4,000 to 3,000. The revised target aims for a tenancy ratio of 1.56× (vs. 1H24 actual 1.52×). For 2024, MTEL targets high‑single‑digit revenue and EBITDA growth.

tickerNews.title: TRGU Plans 3Q24 Commissioning of New Gresik Plant
tickerNews.content: Cerestar Indonesia (TRGU) President Director Indra Irawan said the company aims to commission a new plant in Gresik in 3Q24, which will increase the plant’s capacity from 600 tons per day to 2,200 tons per day.
